name: Jiaozi
short_description: Savor the delightful jiaozi, a beloved staple of Chinese cuisine, featuring a tender wheat dough enveloping a savory mix of ground beef, pork, and crisp napa cabbage. Perfectly steamed or pan-fried, each bite bursts with flavor and tradition.

name: Baozi
short_description: Steamed to perfection, these fluffy buns cradle a delightful mix of savory fillings, from tender pork to vibrant vegetables. A cherished Chinese breakfast staple, baozi offers a warm embrace for any craving.

name: Wonton
short_description: Delicate wontons, a beloved staple of Chinese cuisine, are filled with a savory mix of shrimp and ground pork, enhanced by ginger and scallions. Served in a fragrant broth, they offer a comforting taste of tradition.

name: Mooncake (Yuebing)
short_description: Delight in the rich tradition of the Mid-Autumn Festival with mooncakes, a delectable shortcrust pastry filled with sweet lotus seed paste or red bean, often adorned with salted egg yolks for a savory twist.

name: Spring rolls (Chun juan)
short_description: Crispy and golden, these traditional Chinese spring rolls are filled with a savory mix of mushrooms, carrots, and bamboo shoots, delivering a delightful crunch in every bite. Perfect for sharing!

name: Shaobing
short_description: Layered and flaky, this Northern Chinese flatbread is brushed with rich sesame oil and topped with crunchy sesame seeds. Perfectly chewy, it's a beloved snack that offers a delightful blend of flavors.

name: Chow mein
short_description: Originating from China, chow mein features a delightful medley of sautéed noodles tossed with tender beef, succulent seafood, and savory chicken or pork. Each bite bursts with umami flavors and a satisfying crunch.

name: Shabu-shabu
short_description: Originating from Mongolia and embraced by Japanese cuisine, this interactive hot pot features tender slices of beef, lamb, pork, and fresh seafood like crab and lobster, simmered quickly in a savory broth. Each bite bursts with flavor, making for a delightful communal dining experience.

name: Sweet and sour sauce (Táng cù)
short_description: Originating from Hunan, sweet and sour sauce delivers a delightful balance of tangy rice vinegar and rich soy sauce, thickened with corn starch and sweetened with sugar for a mouthwatering finish. Perfect for dipping or drizzling!

name: Hot pot
short_description: A cherished Chinese culinary tradition, hot pot invites diners to simmer fresh meats, vegetables, and noodles in a bubbling broth at the table. The result is a vibrant, flavorful feast that encourages sharing and socializing.

name: Mapo doufu
short_description: Originating from Sichuan, this fiery stew features silky tofu nestled in a bold, spicy sauce enriched with minced pork and beef, ginger, and fermented black beans for a savory punch.

name: Chinese crullers (Youtiao)
short_description: Crispy and golden, these Chinese crullers are deep-fried breadsticks that are delightfully airy and chewy. A beloved breakfast staple, they pair perfectly with warm soy milk or congee for a comforting start to the day.

name: Century egg (Pi dan)
short_description: A cherished Chinese delicacy, century egg boasts a rich umami flavor and creamy texture, achieved by preserving duck or quail eggs in a unique lye solution. Enjoy its bold, savory notes as a tantalizing appetizer.

name: Kung pao chicken (Gong bao)
short_description: A beloved staple of Chinese cuisine, this spicy stir-fry features tender chicken tossed with ginger, garlic, and hot peppers, all finished with crunchy peanuts for a satisfying crunch.

name: Zhajiangmian
short_description: Wheat noodles are tossed in a rich, savory soybean sauce, featuring ground pork or beef, and topped with crisp vegetables like cucumber and radish. A beloved Shandong specialty, it’s a comforting taste of home.
most_iconic_place: Old Beijing Zha Jiang Noodle King

name: Dan Dan noodles (Dàndànmiàn)
short_description: Originating from Sichuan, these noodles feature a rich, spicy sauce made with chili oil, ground pork, and vibrant Sichuan pepper. Each bite offers a perfect balance of heat and flavor, making it a beloved classic.

name: Orange chicken (Chen pi ji)
short_description: Battered chicken is perfectly fried and tossed in a vibrant sweet-and-sour orange sauce with a hint of chili. Originating from American-Chinese cuisine, it offers a delightful twist on tradition.

name: Shumai (Shāomài)
short_description: Originating from dim sum traditions in China, these open-topped dumplings delight with a savory blend of steamed ground pork, shrimp, and mushrooms, all wrapped in a delicate wheat flour skin. Each bite bursts with flavor, making them a must-try treat.

name: Siu mei
short_description: Originating from Guangdong province, this savory delight features tender, roasted meats, often marinated in aromatic spices and served with a side of sweet soy sauce. Each bite bursts with smoky flavor, embodying the essence of traditional Chinese barbecue.

name: Jianbing
short_description: Originating from China, jianbing is a beloved street food breakfast option, featuring a thin, savory crêpe made from a blend of flours, eggs, and scallions, cooked to crispy perfection. Enjoy the delightful contrast of textures and flavors in every bite!

name: Red-cooking (Hong shao)
short_description: Originating from China, red-cooking infuses ingredients with a rich blend of soy sauce, rice wine, and caramelized sugar through slow-braising. The result is a deeply flavorful and aromatic dish that embodies comforting tradition.

name: Egg tart (Dàntà)
short_description: Originating from Cantonese cuisine, these delightful pastries feature a buttery, flaky crust filled with rich, velvety egg custard, perfectly balancing sweet and savory flavors in every bite.

name: Peking duck (Beijing kao ya)
short_description: Originating from the Yuan Dynasty, Peking duck features succulent American Pekin, crisp skin, and a sweet-savory glaze of hoisin, honey, and five-spice. Each bite is a flavorful journey through Beijing's culinary heritage.

name: Har gow (Xiājiǎo)
short_description: Delicately crafted with a translucent wrapper, these Cantonese dumplings burst with succulent shrimp and crisp bamboo shoots. A staple of dim sum culture, har gow offers a delightful balance of flavors and textures.
